snippet: The state plans to use application fee waivers and other information to address a pattern that limits social mobility.
abstract: Delaware announces new effort to encourage high-achieving low-income students to apply to top colleges, saying it will send application fee waivers and other information to every such high school senior in the state; program is a response to research showing that most poor students with high grades do not apply to top colleges, pattern which contributes to income inequality and holds down social mobility.
lead_paragraph: The state plans to use application fee waivers and other information to address a pattern that limits social mobility.

headline.main: Delaware Seeks to Steer the Poor to Top Colleges
headline.print_headline: Delaware Seeks to Steer The Poor to Top Colleges
